intro: Alamania punicea, commonly known as the red alamania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its distinctive red stems and finely divided, feathery leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Alamania punicea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
